mentions.context: The shape analysis registration algorithm from Deformetrica (deformetrica.org) [25] was then used to create interpolated geometries for all timepoints in the cardiac cycle between the minimum and maximum deformed timepoints using a kernel width of 1.
The 4D flow post-processing pipeline is publicly available at: https://github.com/SimVascular/Tools/tree/
Blood flow was simulated by solving the 3D Navier-Stokes equations using the open-source solver in SimVascular (simvascular.org) [24].
To confine the 4D flow velocity to the PAs, we created 3D models of the proximal lobar PAs using the open-source software, SimVascular (simvascular.org) [24].
The corrected velocity and 4D CMR images were downloaded and further post-processed for image and velocity analysis using custom Python scripts.
To automate extraction of hemodynamic metrics from the PAs, centerlines were generated for each PA geometry at each timepoint using the Vascular Modeling ToolKit (vmtk.org) [26].
To analyze the velocity and anatomic data of the PAs from the 4D flow CMR, we developed a semi-automated 4D flow CMR post-processing pipeline using custom Python scripts (Fig. 1).
